description:
**Ray**

This dashboard provides insights into your Ray services. You can use the dashboard to track health status, performance, and resource utilization metrics from all your services. You can also get in-depth information on the workload deployment that are currently running in your instance, the workers they leverage, and the resource consumption breakdown. 

**Useful Links**

* [Integration Docs](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/ray)
* [Blog](https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/monitor-ray-with-datadog)
title: Ray Overview Dashboard

definition.content:
**Ray**

This dashboard provides insights into your Ray services. You can use the dashboard to track health status, performance, and resource utilization metrics from all your services. You can also get in-depth information on the workload deployment that are currently running in your instance, the workers they leverage, and the resource consumption breakdown.
This section provides you with an overview of your system activity.  The monitor summary notifies you of Ray alerts.

This section provides a breakdown of your resource utilization. This includes a summary of CPU, Memory, USS and RSS by component as well as network speeds, disk usage and node-specific memory/cpu usage.

definition.title: CPU of all components on node
Queries Waiting for Replica Assignments vs Replica Restarts

definition.content: When investigating logs, you can refer to the timeseries data to see the ratio of a certain log status to other expected statuses. In situations where you notice an increase in the ratio of error logs, you can refer to the log stream set up to filter erroneous logs.

Scheduler metrics categorize Pending and Failed tasks by the reason they are blocked, and showcase the time for workloads (e.g. task/actor/etc.) to be placed. Users can troubleshoot task failures, and optimize task placement algorithms using this data.

definition.title: Pending Tasks with Reason for Blocker
Failed Tasks with Reason for Worker Unavailability
Time for Workload to be placed

definition.content: Processes are lightweight, parallel units of computation that encapsulate tasks or functions. They provide a flexible way to distribute and execute workloads within the Ray framework. This section provides the resource usage and status of processes.

formulas.alias: Workers started from Cached Worker Processes
Cumulative number of lease requests from raylet

definition.content: This section provides information on HTTP requests and Queued queries for Ray Serve.

definition.title: Current Number of Queued Queries per Application
